tutorial.title: Book Store Analytics
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your SQL Aggregate functions knowledge to gather some interesting facts about your small book shop

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, you will put your knowledge in SQL into use. You own a small book stationery in town and you need to know how business is going.

You want to get an overview of the total number of books in the store. 

1. Query the database and get the count of all books. Use `Total Number of Books` as an alias.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT COUNT(*) AS "Total Number of Books" FROM Books;

lessons.title: Count of Books in Each Category

executableContent.instructions:
Great work! You now want to know how many books are in each category.

1. List the category name and the count of books in each one.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT category, COUNT(*) AS "Total Number of Books" FROM Books GROUP BY category;

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
- You will need to use the `GROUP BY` clause to group books by category.
- Pay attention to the Alias used in the Expected result table.

executableContent.instructions:
Doing great so far. Another very important piece of information is listing the book that has the highest availability in stock (i.e: a lot of copies of it are available in stock)

1. Clear the Previous Query.
2. Write a new query to find the book with the most copies in stock and list its name. Use `Copies in Stock` as an alias.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT title, MAX(in_stock) AS "Copies in Stock" FROM Books;

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's find the book that has the lowest quantity in stock.

1. Edit the previous query and find the book with the least copies in stock and list its name.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT title, MIN(in_stock) AS "Copies in Stock" FROM Books;

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: - Pay attention to the Alias used in the Expected result table.

executableContent.instructions:
Excellent job. Now, identify which book has the most pages in it.

1. Edit the previous query and find the book with the biggest number of pages and list its name. Use the same alias used in the expected result table.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT title, MAX(pages_count) AS "Pages Count" FROM Books;

lessons.title: Total Number of Books in Stock

executableContent.instructions:
Great job. Now we need to get an insight into how many books we have available in stock.

1. Clear the previous query.
2. Write a new query to find the sum of all books that are available in stock. Pay attention to the alias used in the expected result table.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT SUM(in_stock) AS "Total Copies in Stock" FROM Books;

executableContent.instructions:
Another fancy statistic you can obtain is the average book length of all the books that you have available in store.

1. Clear the previous query.
2. Write a new query to find the average sum of all pages of all available books. Pay attention to the alias used in the expected result table.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT AVG(pages_count) AS "Average Book Length" FROM Books;
